subject: AI & Agents
title: Fairness in Recommendations
description: A quick win: understand Fairness in Recommendations.

hook.text: Your job recommender shows executive roles mostly to men. The training data was biased.

buildup.text: Fairness means equitable exposure and outcomes across user groups and item providers.

discovery.text: Types: user fairness (equal service), item fairness (equal exposure), and provider fairness.

twist.text: Optimizing for one type of fairness can reduce another. Trade-offs are unavoidable.

climax.text: Audit recommendations by group. Measure disparity. Set acceptable thresholds and monitor.

punchline.text: Fair algorithms don't happen by accident. Design for equity.

quiz.question: Why must fairness be actively designed into recommenders?
options: Training data biases are amplified without fairness constraints
Models are always fair by default
